intro: Saxifraga hakkariensis, commonly known as the Hakkari saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clustered leaves. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
